properties.address: Age UK Gateshead, Gateshead, Tyne and Wear NE8 1AS
properties.description: Our warm space is open to anyone in the community of Gateshead, with our primary focus being on those over 50. properties.address: Alphabetti Theatre, Tyne and Wear NE1 4HZ
properties.description: Our space is open to all with zero expectation for anyone to spend any money. Our bar/cafe has free darts, free pool, a free craft station, we have free Wi-Fi, a free library of plays, poetry and prose. We offer free tea/coffee/squash and sell the best cheese toasties in Newcastle from £4.50 (vegan options available). The first week of every Alphabetti play is always Pay What You Feel, anonymously and after the show, if you can't afford to pay, that ok we believe great art is for everyone regardless of their financial situation. All other gigs and performances offer No Questions tickets for £3. We offer captioned, audio described and relaxed performances for all Alphabetti plays.
properties.title: Alphabetti Theatre

properties.address: Newcastle Cathedral, Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear NE1 1PF
properties.description: Newcastle Cathedral has been a beacon of light for the people of the North East for nearly 800 years. For much of that time, our iconic Lantern Tower has served as a sign to our communities that they were approaching safety and belonging as they returned home to this city and region. Inspired by Jesus Christ, the Light of the World, the Cathedral today continues to serve its communities through its deep commitment to being a place of radical welcome, offering inspiring worship, and striving to empower worth within all who come into contact with us. Whilst we are based in the City of Newcastle, we are also the ‘Mother Church’ of the Diocese of Newcastle, and seat of the Bishop of Newcastle. Newcastle is the Church of England’s most northerly diocese, covering the whole of Northumberland as well as areas covered by Newcastle City and North Tyneside Councils. Our role is to be a focus of unity and a resource for the Church of England’s 240 local churches and 49 schools, which are also striving to be beacons of light where they are located.
properties.title: Newcastle Cathedral

properties.address: Methodist Church, Gateshead, Tyne and Wear NE8 4LH
properties.description: Peace of Mind provides a welcoming and supportive environment for refugees, asylum seekers, and individuals facing financial difficulties due to the cost of living crisis. Located in Bensham, Gateshead, this initiative offers a warm welcome where community members can gather, enjoy hot drinks, and connect with others every Wednesday. The space serves as a safe haven, fostering a sense of community and belonging while addressing immediate needs by connecting individuals with various support services available in Gateshead. Our place also offers emergency food parcels and weather-appropriate clothing donations. Peace of Mind aims to alleviate stress and promote well-being among vulnerable populations by offering practical and emotional support.
properties.title: Warm Welcome by Peace of Mind

properties.address: Wood Green Communal Lounge, Gateshead, Tyne & Wear NE10 0SX
properties.description: You can expect to be made welcome by staff and volunteers at our warm welcome space. There's tea, coffee, cordial and biscuits available daily. Phone and laptop charging available. You can watch TV or listen to the radio, play pool, read and generally socialise with others. Our communal lounge is warm, safe and friendly, where people can come together in a non-judgemental environment. We can offer a signposting service relating to all services provided by Gateshead Council and partner agencies. We have exercise/games sessions on a Tuesday, between 2.30 and 3.30pm. We have a bingo session on Monday and Wednesday nights, between 5.30 and 7.30pm We are currently in the process of registering as a volunteer hub, so you can become a regular volunteer at Wood Green if you choose. this could be for activities within the communal lounge and also our surrounding garden areas, which includes hens. Our Warm Welcome Space is free, but donations are welcome and will be used to replenish stock for future use. The Communal Lounge is on bus route 27. Please contact Craig using the contact details below for more information about what's on. Craig Tilley 07766443326 craigtilley@gateshead.gov.uk Wood Green Bill Quay Gateshead NE10 0SX
properties.title: Wood Green Communal Lounge
